de.javasoft.swing.filter
Class ColumnFilter<M>

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.beans.AbstractBean
      de.javasoft.swing.filter.ColumnFilter<M>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractComparableColumnFilter, BooleanColumnFilter, CollectionColumnFilter, ComparableColumnFilter, PatternColumnFilter, SimpleColumnFilter
public abstract class ColumnFilter<M>
extends org.jdesktop.beans.AbstractBean

Adapter between a column to filter and a filter component. Knows which component to create for filtering and how to create a RowFilter from the input.

This base class handles LifeCycle and RowFilterModel management. Additionally, it contains TextSupport and PopupSupport which subclasses may use to bind their input components to appropriate RowFilter creation triggers.

Concrete extensions must create and maintain input components and a RowFilterModel as appropriate for the data they want to filter.

Constructor Detail

ColumnFilter

public ColumnFilter(int columnIndex)
Instantiates a ColumnFilter for the given column, using the default RowFilterModel as created by this class.

Parameters:
columnIndex - the columnIndex in model-coordinates of the column to filter

ColumnFilter

protected ColumnFilter(int columnIndex,
                       IRowFilterModel<? extends M> filterModel)
Instantiates a ColumnFilter for columnIndex and RowFilterModel. Subclasses may decide to expose this constructor if they deem it safe enough for general usage. Which mostly is not the case, as typically there's a strong coupling between the type expectations of the model and the input components.

Parameters:
columnIndex - the columnIndex of the table column to filter
filterModel - the RowFilterModel to use with this filter. Maybe null to denote using the filterModel as created in createRowFilterModel.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the model is not null and its columnIndex is not the same as the given columnIndex.
Method Detail

getColumnIndex

public int getColumnIndex()
Returns the column index of the filter.

Returns:
the columnIndex of the RowFilter.

setIncremental

public void setIncremental(boolean incremental)
Sets the incremental property. That is, a boolean indicating whether the filtering should be incremental.

If its value is changed, this implementation calls updateIncremental to allow subclasses to refresh internal state as needed.

The default value is false.

Parameters:
incremental - a boolean indicating whether the filtering should be incremental.
See Also:
isIncremental(), updateIncremental()

updateIncremental

protected void updateIncremental()
Updates internal state after changes to the incremental property. This implementation does nothing, subclasses should override if needed.

isIncremental

public boolean isIncremental()
Returns the incremental property.

Returns:
the incremental property.
See Also:
setIncremental(boolean)

getRowFilter

public javax.swing.RowFilter<? super M,? super java.lang.Integer> getRowFilter()
Returns the column's RowFilter.

Returns:
the RowFilter to use for this column.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called after the filter has been released.

clear

public abstract void clear()
Resets the state of the filtering component to not filter and resets the column's RowFilter.

getFilteringComponent

public javax.swing.JComponent getFilteringComponent()
Returns the filtering component, guaranteed to be not null. This method must not be accessed after the filter has been released.

Returns:
the filtering component.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called after the filter has been released.

release

public void release()
Releases all internal bindings/listeners. Client code must not use the filter after calling this.

doRelease

protected abstract void doRelease()
Releases all internal bindings/listeners, guaranteed to be called only if LifeCycle is Activated.

createFilteringComponent

protected abstract javax.swing.JComponent createFilteringComponent()
Creates and returns the filtering component (aka: the container to add into the filter row). This method is called once when the ColumnFilter's LifeCycle is in state INSTANTIATED. Subclasses must guarantee to have created and installed all internally used Components and Listeners.

Returns:
the filtering component, must not be null.

getLifeCycle

public final ColumnFilter.LifeCycle getLifeCycle()

matchValueChanged

protected abstract void matchValueChanged()
Callback method from listeners which detected a change in an input component which represent the matchValue. This must be implemented to update the rowFilterModel's matchValue from the current value/s of the input components.

createMatchValueChangedAction

protected javax.swing.Action createMatchValueChangedAction()
Creates and returns and Action which calls matchValueChanged.

Returns:
the Action which triggers a matchValueChanged.

createClearAction

protected javax.swing.Action createClearAction()
Creates and returns and Action which calls clear.

Returns:
an Action which triggers a clear.

getMatchRules

protected java.util.List<?> getMatchRules()
Returns the list of match rules which are supported. This implementation returns the same list as the underlying RowFilterModel. Subclasses can override to support a subset of the complete list.

Returns:
the list of matchrules which are supported.
See Also:
IRowFilterModel.getMatchRules()

matchRuleChanged

protected void matchRuleChanged(java.lang.Object rule)
Callback method from listeners which detected a change in an input component which represents the matchRule as returned by the ui.

This implementation first calls updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChange and then sets the RowFilterModel's matchRule after unwrapping the given value into model coordinates.

Parameters:
rule - the match rule as returned by the ui, must not be null
See Also:
updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChanged(Object), unwrapMatchRule(Object)

updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChanged

protected void updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChanged(java.lang.Object rule)
Updates state of filter components as appropriate after a change of match rule. The input is the match rule as returned by the ui.

Parameters:
rule - the match rule as returned by the ui, must not be null

getMatchRuleName

protected java.lang.String getMatchRuleName(java.lang.Object rule)
Returns the localized name of the match rule.

This implementation returns the name of the Action, if the input is of type AbstractActionExt. Otherwise, returns the toString of the input.

Parameters:
rule - the match rule as returned by the ui, must not be null
Returns:
localized name of the match rule

unwrapMatchRule

protected java.lang.Object unwrapMatchRule(java.lang.Object rule)
Returns the matchRule as needed by the RowFilterModel.

This implementation returns the value for key "matchRule" of the Action if the input is of type AbstractActionExt. Otherwise returns the input as is.

Parameters:
rule - the match rule as returned by the ui, must not be null
Returns:
the match rule as needed by the RowFilterModel

getRowFilterModel

protected IRowFilterModel<? extends M> getRowFilterModel()
Returns the RowFilterModel for this ColumnFilter. It's guaranteed to be not null in LifeCycle states INSTANTIATED and ACTIVATED, and null in RELEASED.

Returns:
the RowFilterModel for this ColumnFilter.

createRowFilterModel

protected IRowFilterModel<? extends M> createRowFilterModel(int columnIndex)
Creates the RowFilterModel used in this ColumnFilter. This implementation creates a SimpleFilterModel. Subclasses should override as needed.

Returns:
the default RowFilterModel used in this ColumnFilter.

rowFilterChanged

protected void rowFilterChanged(javax.swing.RowFilter<?,?> oldValue,
                                javax.swing.RowFilter<?,?> newValue)
Callback method when the RowFilter property of the RowFilterModel changed. This implementation fires a PropertyChangeEvent with property name "rowFilter".

Parameters:
oldValue - the old value of the RowFilter property
newValue - the new value of the RowFilter property

createRowFilterModelListener

protected java.beans.PropertyChangeListener createRowFilterModelListener()
Creates and returns the PropertyChangeListener to the RowFilterModel. This implementation listens to the rowFilter property and calls rowFilterChanged. NOTE: subclassed which want to support full bi-directional binding between rowFilterModel and matchRule/value input components should override this method and enhance the callback mechanism as needed.

Returns:
the listener to add to the RowFilterModel.

installRowFilterModel

protected void installRowFilterModel(int columnIndex,
                                     IRowFilterModel<? extends M> filterModel)
Installs a RowFilterModel for the given column index. If the given filterModel is null, creates the default.

Parameters:
columnIndex - the columnIndex to filter
filterModel - the RowFilterModel to use, may be null to indicate creation of a default
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a given model's columnIndex is not the same as the given columnIndex
See Also:
createRowFilterModel(int)

uninstallRowFilterModel

protected void uninstallRowFilterModel()
Uninstalls and nulls the RowFilterModel.

getRowFilterModelListener

protected java.beans.PropertyChangeListener getRowFilterModelListener()
Returns the PropertyChangeListener to register with the RowFilterModel. The listener is lazily creates if necessary.

Returns:
the PropertyChangeListener to register with the RowFilterModel, guaranteed to be not null.
See Also:
createRowFilterModelListener()
